turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Kirchenkampf.
turn.1: What is important about this article?
turn.2: In his "Myth of the Twentieth Century" (1930), Rosenberg had described the Catholic Church as one of the main enemies of Nazism.
turn.3: Was there any response to this?
turn.4: The church responded on 16 February 1934 with the banning of Rosenberg's book.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The Sanctum Officium recommended that Rosenberg's book be put on the "Index Librorum Prohibitorum" (forbidden books list of the Catholic Church) for scorning and rejecting "all dogmas of the Catholic Church, indeed the very fundamentals of the Christian religion".
turn.8: Clemens August Graf von Galen, the Bishop of Münster, derided the neo-pagan theories of Rosenberg as perhaps no more than "an occasion for laughter in the educated world", but warned that "his immense importance lies in the acceptance of his basic notions as the authentic philosophy of National Socialism and in his almost unlimited power in the field of German education.
turn.9: Did he have any other influences?
turn.10: Herr Rosenberg must be taken seriously if the German situation is to be understood." Under Nazi youth leader Baldur von Schirach, Catholic youth organizations were disbanded and Catholic children corralled into the Hitler Youth.
turn.12: Pope Pius XI issued a message to the youth of Germany on 2 April 1934, noting propaganda and pressure being exerted to point German youth "away from Christ and back to paganism".
